title: Pindan axes 40 jobs but gets Rio Tinto contract
text:
Perth-based construction company Pindan has snared a $90 million contract to build an operations village in the Pilbara for Rio Tinto following last week's takeover by its funder and major shareholder, Singapore-listed developer Oxley Holdings.

Pindan has axed 40 jobs after it failed to meet performance targets set by Oxley. The group's two founders, George Allingame and David Pringle, have left the business.

Pindan's Graceview apartments on Sydney's north shore.

The troubled company ran into cashflow problems in 2018 after falling behind on its payments to subcontractors and other creditors.

Pindan declined to comment on the job cuts but said the "group was undergoing a restructure to improve operational efficiencies".

"Until discussions have been held with staff and the restructure is complete, Pindan is unable to comment," a spokeswoman said.
description: The group has cut jobs after it failed to meet performance targets set by funder and major shareholder Oxley Holdings.
